Fields.DialogueText: Suffren, change our course to this heading. We have a new mission.
Care to share any details?
Basic search and rescue of a, hmmm, Lord Alastair Rupert Cobleton III.
Typical.
What is?
Assigning one of the most effective warships to rescue a single person.
I'm sure Command has their reasons.
Reason - money. I'd bet my main cannon Lord Connard has money spilling out of his pockets.

Fields.MenuText: Cobleton - and, yes, the report mentions his wealth. So?
That's the way it goes sometimes. Are you going to be miserable company on this mission?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't equate a person's worth to their wealth is all.
No more than usual, Capitaine.
Rich or not, they need our help and that's what we are going to provide.
Of course, Capitaine, I wasn't implying... Morgana incoming!
I see them.
@BATTLE
Suffren, report to the bridge.
Oui, Capitaine.
What can I do for you?

Fields.MenuText: Seaman Eugene is in medical. Know anything about that?
Did you break Eugene's nose?
Did you assault a fellow crewmember?

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, I sent him there.
Accidently. I just meant to get his attention but it turns out he's made of glass.
I wouldn't go as far as assault, Capitaine.
What happened?
We were playing that game he made up, "Supreme Naval Commander."
And you lost.
I can have grace in defeat, Captain - but he, the oaf, just wouldn't shut up.
Well, I spoke with everyone else there and they seem to agree he had it coming.
Is he all right?
He is, and I will consider the matter closed if you visit him.
Capitaine, Morganas off our port beam.
Nice try, but-
Capitaine!
Oh.
@BATTLE
The distress beacon was found here at this location?
Approximately, oui.
*ALARM*
Morganas. We can probably narrow down who attacked them.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I located the distress beacon.

Fields.MenuText: Where is it?
Set a course.
Why didn't we notice it before?

Fields.DialogueText: Due east, but it appears to be moving.
I can't set an accurate one yet. It is erratic.
It's faint. Possibly coming from the submersible.
Do your best to get a solid location.
Oui, and I'm sure of it now. The beacon is below, either from a submersible... or sinking.
Let's hope the former.
Capitaine, our present location is the origin of the distress signal.
Any response to us on the radio?
Non, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: Great, how are we supposed to retrieve them?
Can we reach them?
Try once more.

Fields.DialogueText: Have you ever been fishing?
Maybe, if we are a little creative.
As you wish.
Looks like the distress calls drew some Morgana attention.
Ready.
@BATTLE
Using our anchor as a fishing hook to pull up the craft? You're impressive, Suffren.
Flattered, Capitaine... but I must concentrate...
Oh... sorry.
All right you... come on... Drat! I give up!... Wait... non... Got it!
Well done! Bring our catch topside, onto the deck.
Easier said than done.
Capitaine, I would have Sir Coblebottom's submarine open by now if you would let me do things my way.
I'd rather let engineering have a little more time with opening the hatch before we resort to explosives.
Boring.
And wasn't it Lord Cobleton?
Cobblebottom, Dingleshire... it's all the same pasty English gluttons to me... Capitaine.
Uh-huh.
I'm not... fond... of the English, but I'll act professionally.

Fields.MenuText: Can I trust you?
What do you have against the English?
That explains the explosives...

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine... Well, keep a little eye on me but yes.
How long you got to listen?
I know you wouldn't imply I would blow someone up just because they were English.
Regardless, engineering assures me they can get it open.
Captain, Morganas incoming.
Let's try to keep this as steady as possible.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, the crew has opened the sub and examined the inside.
Any survivors?
You saw how small the sub was. There was only one person inside, presumably the late Lord Cobleton.
That's too bad... have the body stored. Anything else?
Only this. It appears to be his diary.

Fields.MenuText: Just a diary? No assets, food, weapons?
Have you read it?
That's huge! How many pages are there?

Fields.DialogueText: Non, Capitaine. Strange.
I glanced at it, but his writing... I can barely stand it.
At least a few hundred, but the writing is large and there appears to be a good deal of... crude doodles.
I need to prepare the report and contact Command. In the meantime, read through the diary and see if he gives any reason for the attack.
Read this?! Capitaine!
Sorry, I need to do the report.
*ALARM*
Morgana, take out some of your rage on them. If they hadn't attacked poor Cobleton's ship you wouldn't be reading his most intimate thoughts.
Oh, I intend to!
@BATTLE
Capitaine, what do you have there?
I don't know. A piece of paper I found in the hall, someone must of dropped it.
Okay.
Listen to what they wrote, "The first rule of dueling club is, you don't talk about dueling club. The second rule..."
Morgana incoming fast!
Huh? Where?
Right there.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I see... barely. How far away are they?
Those specks over there?
I can barely see all the way out there. Are you sure they are heading towards us?

Fields.DialogueText: If they're in my field of vision, they are too close.
Specks? They're not THAT far.
Well, not sure, but they probably are.
You're right. Change our heading to intercept.
Oui, Capitaine. Want me to toss that scrap paper in the bin?
Hmm? Oh, yeah. Thank you.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I don't know if I can finish this diary.
What's the problem?
Listen to this stuff. "I stumbled upon the gardener trapped like a rat in one of our many weasel snaps. It was delightfully droll yet a brief amusement."
Well, maybe you can skim a little more than read.
"My tailor has again assured me that a frock coat dipped in gold would be simply unwearable. How cruel the world is."
Point made.
I will admit, when he isn't prattling on, he does seem to have a sharp mind.

Fields.MenuText: Just skip to the end and see if he describes the attack.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't. There's no discernable order to this. The page order is all over the place.
Well, keep at it. I'd like some answers. Command reports that the L.C.S. Poseidon was spotted with a Morgana escort.
L.C.S.? What prefix is that?.
"Lord Cobleton's Ship."
I'm going to vomit.
Well choke it down, we have Morgana incoming!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Glad you can find something nice to say.
I'm not sure I agree with you.

Fields.DialogueText: You should take your own advice and try to be more charitable, Capitaine.
With grating difficulty only, Capitaine.
Capitaine, I may have found something interesting in Alastair's diary.
The attack?
It may be nothing, but are you familiar with the Teleforce?

Fields.MenuText: Not at all, what is it?
Yeah, that's that quasi-recreational group from Finland, right?
Sure, a theoretical weapon proposed by Nikola Tesla.

Fields.DialogueText: A theoretical weapon thought up by Nikola Tesla.
Non... What?
That's right. I'm impressed.
So what does the Teleforce have to do with Cobleton?
Nikola Tesla claimed the Teleforce could be made. The weapon fires concentrated particles with devastating force. It's commonly confused as a death ray.
What kind of defense is there for a weapon like that?
Other than destroying the weapon? None. Again, it's all theory... but Cobleton is surprisingly informed.
Morgana forces, approaching fast.
Capitaine!
And good work. Get to the bottom of this.
@BATTLE
I've been speaking with Command about Cobleton and the Teleforce. There is some concern.
Capitaine?
Concern that a Teleforce was being built. Considering the security clearances, I would say concern is an understatement.
They knew what Cobleton was doing?
Suspicions, mostly thrown out as nonsense. No one seemed to take him seriously.
Strange.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean?
Not really. The Teleforce does sound like science fiction.
That they didn't take him seriously?

Fields.DialogueText: Could all of the cluelessness and flamboyancy be a ruse? Non, forget I asked.
To a layman perhaps.
Non, and why would they? You heard some of his writing. Still, sometimes it's like a different, vastly intelligent person is hiding underneath.
Right now our orders are to stand by, but we should prepare to pursue the L.C.S. Poseidon.
Captain, Morganas incoming.
@BATTLE
We have new orders. We are to work in tandem with the Free World Traders to find the L.C.S. Poseidon.
The Mercenaries!?
You don't approve.
The Morganas threaten everyone. I don't appreciate people using the conflict as a way to get rich.

Fields.MenuText: I don't like working with them either, but we need to.
Maybe you are judging them a little too harshly.
Some people are just trying to survive.

Fields.DialogueText: Understood, but we should be careful.
Maybe, but I still don't trust them.
I wouldn't call swimming in booze and coin surviving.
We have coordinates for a rendezvous. We'll make our way there and look for a signal.
Of course it couldn't be simple.
Suffren, Morgana off to starboard!
@BATTLE
Suffren, I was wondering... oh sorry am I interrupting?
Oui, just a moment.
Is that your move?
Oui, Seaman Eugene.
Then I move my destroyer here... and fire all weapons, dealing... 37 HP.
HP?
Shh!
Hull Points, Capitaine.
37 points so that... !$%$!... Ahem. Good game, Eugene.
Woo-hoo! Ahem... good game, Suffren.

Fields.MenuText: Who won?
This is a weird game.
I think I'm getting it, Suffren, want to play a game?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine...
It's not weird. It's strategy and THIS JERK- Ahem. It's... strategy.
Not right now. You see-
*ALARM*
Capitaine, I'm heading to the bridge.
Right behind you.
Oh, Capitaine, you could play with me sometime, if you want.
I'll think about it.
Will you be more of a challenge than Suffren?
I doubt it. Your nose looks good, by the way - I can barely tell where it broke.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, the Admiral of the Free World Traders is ready to see you.
Thank you, send him in.
Nice to meet you, "Admiral".
Please, please, call me Torque.
I'm not calling you that.
Then call me sexy.
Okay! Torque, so you have been briefed on the plan?
Oh sure. Morganas are building some kind of death ray, they need parts, and I know which ships are carrying those parts. Follow them, find the bad guys.

Fields.MenuText: And I am in charge of the mission, so you will be taking orders from me.
And recover the L.C.S. Poseidon.
And recover anything relating to the Teleforce.

Fields.DialogueText: Can you handle that, Torque?
Into our custody.
Which is not shared or up for negotiation.
You don't have to worry about me. Government's good, they pay in advance. Throw enough money at us and we'll "Aye, Aye, Captain!" with the best of 'em.
Good to hear.
Captain, Morganas approaching fast.
Should I get back to my ship and give ya a hand?
We're fine. Watch and learn.
@BATTLE
Torque says we should be in visual range of the merchant ship anytime now.
There! The Morganas are attacking!
Order Torque to cover our stern. We're moving in.
He's already moving his ships to intercept the Trader ship.
What!? We don't have a choice, then. Engage the Morganas to keep them off of him.
Capitaine!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Where is Torque?
Are there any more Morgana contacts?
What's the condition of the merchant ship?

Fields.DialogueText: He and his crew are returning from the merchant ship.
Not yet.
It appears to be sinking fast.
Captain, come in, over.
Torque! I didn't order you to board that ship.
Sorry, Captain, but it was going down. I had to evacuate the crew and the equipment. Bad news though, wrong ship.
What!?
Yeah, that's my fault. Morganas were just attacking them because, well, that's what they do. Hey, we did save these people though.
Yes, that's a good thing. Torque, find the right ship!
Understood!
Look's like you're about halfway through that diary, Suffren. What are you reading now?
"The leopard is henceforth denied it's LSD-25. The frivolities were entertaining yet the fatalities have become annoyingly numerous."
Yeesh, anything else about the Teleforce?
Some, nothing useful. Recently he has been focusing on the occult.
The occult?
Witchcraft, magic, illuminati, philosophers stone, that sort of thing.
Well, I guess I'm not surprised.
He writes, "Their tales of magic and wonder entertain but lack true power. When death comes to claim this body, I'll simply purchase a new one from him. Name your price, Grim Reaper. Ha!"

Fields.MenuText: What?
Right, so he is crazy.
How much does a new body cost?

Fields.DialogueText: Apparently he thinks he has enough money to just buy a new body and keep living.
Clearly.
Capitaine... You can't buy a new body when you die.
Suffren, Morganas incoming.
D'accord.
@BATTLE
Captain, just wanted to report, we may have a ship that matches your specs en route.
Thank you, let me know when you have a solid lead we can move on.
Sure, sure. You know, I've been asking around 'bout this Teleforce thing - sounds dangerous.
Don't worry, we will sort it out.
According to these inventories, all they need is something to create a lot of electricity. They have all the other necessary parts.
That's one estimate. Why?
Just curious is all, don't want to get my crew involved in a suicide mission.
"Excitement! For the diamond eye delivered for my servant, Bartholomew, was hustled to the ditch as I'm now informed he apparently has both eyes. Alas, naughty work is called for."
What is she talking about?
That's Cobleton's diary.
Ooo, why are you reading that?

Fields.MenuText: Suffren, she's a comedian.
Now, if you wouldn't mind Torque, we have work to do.
Ha, well, we've all been working hard.

Fields.DialogueText: It's relaxing. See, here he's describing how to remove a man's eye without making a mess of your clothes.
Because I follow orders, unlike some people here.
Because you can leave now Torque. You're boring.
Right, well I'll be going then.
Thank you.
Did he really remove his servant's eye?
Oh, non. Turns out his Albino Alligator had an eye infection a week earlier and had its eye removed. He popped it in there.
Huh... well... No, I don't have a response to that.
Claims it boosted the alligator's confidence too.
Suffren, take a break from that. Morganas incoming.
@BATTLE
Suffren, I need to ask you about a rumor I heard.
Oui?
Are you the leader of some kind of dueling club on the ship?
Who told you that?
Suffren...
They're not supposed to talk about dueling club...
Suffren!
Oui, but it's not a club. It's just training. I want to make sure the crew can defend themselves in case of a boarding.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that sounds good, but why the secrecy?
What's with all the crazy rules?
Is that why I have seen so many "accidents"?

Fields.DialogueText: I wanted it to be a surprise?
Discipline stuff is complicated.
Non, some of those were legitimate accidents. I guarantee two of them at least.
Keep me informed and keep it under control.
Oui, Capitaine.
And change the name to something more professional. I don't want to explain "dueling club" on my reports.
Consider it done.
Do I see Morganas?
If you're seeing what I'm seeing! Bringing us about.
@BATTLE
Suffren, Torque has a plan and I think we are going to go with it.
I don't like the sound of that already.
The shipment we were waiting on was cancelled, so he wants to set up a decoy with a dummy component and beacon.
For which he wants more money.
That goes without saying.
Hey, sorry, I was here and just wanted to let you know, because I'm no eavesdropper.
Don't worry, I could smell you.
Okay, what's your problem!?

Fields.MenuText: She loses her temper and forgets to be professional sometimes, right, Suffren?
She has trouble trusting you, and I tend to agree.
Both of you, calm down!

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, Capitaine.
Merci, Capitaine.
Oui, Capitaine.
So, like we discussed, just need the specs for the Teleforce - and I can make a suitable decoy.
We'll have them sent when they are prepared.
Capitaine?
Suffren, contact Command to arrange the additional funds transfer for the Free World Traders.
... Oui.
Thank you kindly! Guess I'll be going.
Capitaine!
Suffren, it'll all...
Non, Morganas!
@BATTLE
Then I will move my dingy to the stern of your battleship and attack.
Attack!? With the dingy? Are you insulting me, or did you forget how to play?
That's two HP of damage.
Oh no! Well then, in response, I turn my battleship 90 degrees to fire all weapons at your dingy.
Hey!
That's 57 HP of damage. No need to do the math - goodbye, little dingy.
I... You...
Wooo! That's 84 HP to your battleship.
84?! 84, that's... that's...
Oui?
You win... You... Lucky...
Bah bah bah, lose with dignity. A tip? You're consistently a bully when you play, which makes you predictable after a few games.
Suffren, we have Morgana incoming. Report to the bridge.
Ahem, good game, Eugene.
Good game.
YEAH! THAT'S WHAT YOU GET!! BOOOOOOM!!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: What was "HP" again?
Excessive. Does this game make you track how much ammunition you expend?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but I have more than enough to beat her.
Ahem. "Hull Points."

Fields.MenuText: That seemed pointless, Suffren.

Fields.DialogueText: Just wait, Capitaine.
And now that you've exposed your port to MY battlehip, Seaman Eugene, I attack with all weapons.
Capitaine, I found the description of the attack in the diary.
Okay, let me hear it.
"The brigands arrive at last. The slight amusement their resolve brings me does not compare to their offensive smell, however. Time to take flight!
No mention of the Teleforce?
"Alas, my personal vessel overflowing with gold leaves little room for me and none for the Teleforce Array. How droll!"
Gold? I thought you found just him and this diary?
We did, Capitaine. I don't think we can count on any of this to be reliable, as he was out of his mind.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry, that was a waste of time.
Well, it made for some entertainment?
Thanks for combing through it. Someone had to.

Fields.DialogueText: It was, but someone had to do it. No need to apologize.
I feel like I need to wash my brain.
Next time, find someone else.
Standing order, Suffren will no longer be required to read books.
Don't say it like that! Makes me sound like I don't read.
How about, "If Suffren no want read word-pages, she no do going to be doing reading."
You think you're funny.
You don't?
No... sometimes, but not now.
Morganas incoming.
So there are.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Capitaine, it's the L.C.S. Poseidon.
And there goes Torque and his ships.
Did you give the order?
No, but I expected no less. Engage the Morganas!
@BATTLE
Captain, come in, Captain. This is Torque on the L.C.S. Poseidon.
Well done, Torque, thank you. Now please take your crew and return to your ship.
Well, Captain, I've been thinking that the Free World Traders are living in dangerous times. We need to defend ourselves.
Torque, don't do something you'll regret.
You're right, Miss Suffren. I won't be handing over the Teleforce, Captain. Appologies, maybe I'll sell you a few, once we get them into production... Hey!
Stand down! That's an order! This is mutiny!

Fields.MenuText: You were too greedy, Torque.
They're not your crew anymore.
You shouldn't have betrayed us, Torque.

Fields.DialogueText: You just had to have more and more.
Works a little differently when command isn't based around trust, doesn't it?
You were a little too obvious, too.
You kept too much pay for yourself Torque. Suffren, made them a better offer.
What did you say again? "Throw enough money at us and we'll 'Aye, Aye, Captain!' with the best of em?"
Crewmembers, please remove yourselves and Torque from the ship.
Yes, Captain.
Well done, Suffren.
And you, Capitaine.
His own crew is turning on him, Capitaine!
Captain, everyone is off the L.C.S. Poseidon.
Good - let's get ready for this.
Morgana approaching the L.C.S. Poseidon.
Get us in there, Suffren!
@BATTLE
Do we have an all clear?
Oui.

Fields.MenuText: This is the right call.
This is a bad idea.
What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to convince me, Capitaine.
Orders are orders.
It's regrettable but necessary, Capitaine.
And since no nation can agree on who should have the Teleforce, no one can.
Whom would you trust with it?
You're right. That's a short list, Suffren.
Capitaine.
Destroy the L.C.S. Poseidon. Fire!
So, Suffren, how is the dueling club going? And what did you change the name to?
Oh that? Well, sadly it's concluded.

Fields.MenuText: Concluded, huh?
I didn't know there was a set finish date.
What happened?

Fields.DialogueText: I shut it down.
Well there wasn't, per se.
You know how things go.
Suffren, what did the name change to?
Project Havoc.
Oh.
Things got a little out of control, but I put an end to it. Can we drop it?
Sure.
Merci, Capitaine.
Is that related in ANY way to why some of the crew are walking around with shaved heads?
Oui.
Okay.
Morganas to starboard.
Get us in range and start blasting, Suffren.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, any word on our next assignment?
Not yet. Have anything you're hoping for?
Actually I look forward to a little time in port.
Really?
Oui, even I need a break from the battle every now and then.
You deserve it, and so does the crew.
And you, Capitaine.
I'll put in a request.
And when we get there, save a little time. I'm taking you out for dinner.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds good. Whose turn is it to pay?
Maybe some drinks after?
Do I get to pick what we eat?

Fields.DialogueText: Probably yours, but I'm buying.
Ha! We'll see where the night takes us.
Absolutely not.
*ALARM*
Incoming!
Ready!
@BATTLE
Suffren, listen to this.
What is it?
A correspondence from the Cobleton estate. Came in official mail.
Must be a request for the body. Probably going to be a ridiculous funeral, if the family is anything like him.
"My gratitude but the preservation of that body is an unnecessary trifle. Dispose of it as you will. Cheers."
Huh, I was wrong but not surprised.
Look at the handwriting.

Fields.MenuText: You think?
Pretty close, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: Suffren?
Non, non, non. I am not doing this!
What?
Entertaining the idea that Lord Cobleton BOUGHT a new body from death and is now writing us to chuck his old one in the trash.
Still, it's weird. The language, handwritting, it's sp-
Non. I would much rather think about our dinner.
So would I, now that you mention it.
Non.
No?
